1   package ch.akuhn.matrix.eigenvalues;
2   
3   import java.util.Arrays;
4   
5   import org.netlib.lapack.LAPACK;
6   import org.netlib.util.intW;
7   
8   import ch.akuhn.matrix.Matrix;
9   import ch.akuhn.matrix.Vector;
10  
11  /**
12   * Finds all eigenvalues of a matrix.
13   * <P>
14   * Computes for an <code>n</code>&times;<code>n</code> real nonsymmetric matrix
15   * <code>A</code>, the eigenvalues (&lambda;) and, optionally, the left and/or
16   * right eigenvectors. The computed eigenvectors are normalized to have
17   * Euclidean norm equal to 1 and largest component real.
18   * <P>
19   * 
20   * @author Adrian Kuhn
21   * 
22   * @see "http://www.netlib.org/lapack/double/dgeev.f"
23   * 
24   */
25  public class AllEigenvalues extends Eigenvalues {
26  
27  	private LAPACK lapack = LAPACK.getInstance();
28  
29  	private boolean l = true;
30  	private boolean r = false;
31  
32  	/**
33  	 * Construct with the given matrix
34  	 * 
35  	 * @param A
36  	 */
37  	public AllEigenvalues(Matrix A) {
38  		super(A.columnCount());
39  		assert A.isSquare();
40  		this.A = A;
41  	}
42  
43  	private Matrix A;
44  
45  	@Override
46  	public AllEigenvalues run() {
47  		final double[] wr = new double[n];
48  		final double[] wi = new double[n];
49  		final intW info = new intW(0);
50  		final double[] a = A.asColumnMajorArray();
51  		final double[] vl = new double[l ? n * n : 0];
52  		final double[] vr = new double[r ? n * n : 0];
53  		final double[] work = allocateWorkspace();
54  		lapack.dgeev(
55  				jobv(l),
56  				jobv(r),
57  				n,
58  				a, // overwritten on output!
59  				n,
60  				wr, // output: real eigenvalues
61  				wi, // output: imaginary eigenvalues
62  				vl, // output:: left eigenvectors
63  				n,
64  				vr, // output:: right eigenvectors
65  				n,
66  				work,
67  				work.length,
68  				info);
69  		if (info.val != 0)
70  			throw new Error("dgeev ERRNO=" + info.val);
71  		postprocess(wr, vl);
72  		return this;
73  	}
74  
75  	/**
76  	 * <PRE>
77  	 * [wr,vl.enum_cons(n)]
78  	 *  .transpose
79  	 *  .sort_by(&:first)
80  	 *  .tranpose
81  	 *  .revert
82  	 * </PRE>
83  	 * 
84  	 */
85  	private void postprocess(double[] wr, double[] vl) {
86  		class Eigen implements Comparable<Eigen> {
87  			double value0;
88  			Vector vector0;
89  
90  			@Override
91  			public int compareTo(Eigen eigen) {
92  				return Double.compare(value0, eigen.value0);
93  			}
94  		}
95  		final Eigen[] eigen = new Eigen[n];
96  		for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
97  			eigen[i] = new Eigen();
98  			eigen[i].value0 = wr[i];
99  			eigen[i].vector0 = Vector.copy(vl, i * n, n);
100 		}
101 		Arrays.sort(eigen);
102 		value = new double[nev];
103 		vector = new Vector[nev];
104 		for (int i = 0; i < nev; i++) {
105 			value[i] = eigen[n - nev + i].value0;
106 			vector[i] = eigen[n - nev + i].vector0;
107 		}
108 	}
109 
110 	private String jobv(boolean canHasVectors) {
111 		return canHasVectors ? "V" : "N";
112 	}
113 
114 	/**
115 	 * If LWORK = -1, then a workspace query is assumed; the routine only
116 	 * calculates the optimal size of the WORK array, returns this value as the
117 	 * first entry of the WORK array.
118 	 * 
119 	 */
120 	private double[] allocateWorkspace() {
121 		int lwork = ((l || r) ? 4 : 3) * n;
122 		final double[] query = new double[1];
123 		final intW info = new intW(0);
124 		lapack.dgeev(
125 				jobv(l),
126 				jobv(r),
127 				n,
128 				null,
129 				n,
130 				null,
131 				null,
132 				null,
133 				n,
134 				null,
135 				n,
136 				query,
137 				-1,
138 				info);
139 		if (info.val == 0)
140 			lwork = (int) query[0];
141 		return new double[lwork];
142 	}
143 
144 }
